image.altText: A couple embrace in a white room as a lady watches on

props.synopsis: There are emotional reunions in Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories, following the sixth round of hostage and prisoner releases under the Gaza ceasefire deal.

title.children: Freed Israeli learns child's name, as released Palestinians burn shirts

image.altText: Anthony Albanese press conference

props.synopsis: Nobody is suggesting the prime minister needlessly antagonise the US president but whether he likes it or not, Anthony Albanese's future on tariffs is in Donald Trump's hands.Â

title.children: Albanese's Trump tariff 'test' is an insult to all Australians

image.altText: Dozens of people of all ages line up outside a "For Lease" sign at a Sydney apartment building.

props.synopsis: Progress is being made to better protect renters' data and make applications fairer, but experts say it may not be enough to shift the power imbalance between estate agents and tenants.

title.children: Reigning in a rental market based on 'vibes' and unregulated databases

image.altText: For sale sign in front of apartment building

props.synopsis: A two-year ban on the foreign purchase of existing Australian homes is now bipartisan policy.

title.children: Labor matches Coalition ban on foreign housing investment

image.altText: Hand holding phone showing serious older balding man wear white sleeveless vest, blue checked sarong sitting in a blue room.

props.synopsis: For three weeks, the body of Pastor Subhash Baghel languished in a morgue, his burial blocked by local Hindu tribal groups refusing to allow him to be laid to rest in his own village.Â

title.children: Pastor denied burial as Christians and Hindus clash over conversions

image.altText: Woman in white three-quarter sleeve dress seated with hand on knee of her partner, a man in jeans and shirt. They sit outside

props.synopsis: When Laura and Colin's partners died suddenly from the same condition, they were shocked to find themselves falling in love while still grieving.

title.children: When widower Col found new love, he never expected to lose friends over it

image.altText: A close up photo of Lynda McMinn, who is wearing a clerical collar, green cardigan and teal spectacles

props.synopsis: Thirty-three years ago, to much celebration, women were made priests in the Anglican Diocese of Canberra and Goulburn. A new era, it was thought, had begun.

title.children: Why a female priest stays when so many women have left the church

image.altText: Two men in safety gear rappel down a large, curved roof to inspect a heavily damaged section.

props.synopsis: A drone armed with an explosive warhead pierced the containment shell over Chernobyl's melted-down nuclear reactor early on Friday morning, causing a small fire but major concerns for peace prospects.

title.children: A drone struck Chernobyl. It may damage peace talks more than concrete

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Don't worry, I'm expecting another mediocre result. Go on, prove me wrong.

title.children: Think your intellect is a match for my quiz? I doubt it

image.altText: The roof of a home has been ripped off

props.synopsis: Dramatic footage shows parts of a remote town underwater in WA's north west after ex-tropical cyclone Zelia turned streets into rivers across the Pilbara region.

title.children: Parts of remote town underwater as Cyclone Zelia turns streets into rivers

image.altText: Elon Musk standing behind a podium, raising his fists in the air and shouting.

title.children: Is Elon Musk orchestrating a coup? Here's what we know about DOGE

image.altText: Jannik Sinner holds up Australian Open trophy.

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner, the number-one ranked men's tennis player in the world, accepts a three-month suspension for two positive doping tests after striking a deal with WADA.

title.children: Sinner accepts three-month doping ban after striking deal with WADA

image.altText: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler stand at a podium, impersonating Sarah Palin and Hillary Clinton.

title.children: From The Muppets to Wayne's World â SNL changed comedy over 50 years

image.altText: Two man stand on street wearing black suits. One smiles and one has serious expression.

props.synopsis: Industry resignations and anger have followed the shock decision by Creative Australia to drop artist Khaled Sabsabi from one of the world's most prestigious cultural events.

title.children: Resignations and anger as industry reacts to artist dropped from event

image.altText: Innovators

props.synopsis: Two men, from opposite ends of the world, within the space of two years both dared to change cricket, by hitting the ball where most thought it could not be hit.

title.children: How men from two ends of the world have claims to cricket's ramp shot

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

image.altText: A person holds a maugean skate out of the water.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has written to the salmon industry to confirm laws will be introduced that will protect salmon farms on Tasmania's west coast.

title.children: Prime minister promises law change to protect salmon farms

image.altText: sydney train commuters carry bags as they try board a packed train at a sydney rail station

props.synopsis: At least a quarter of Sydney's trains services were cancelled on Friday when hundreds of staff failed to show up for work with further staff absences impacting services today.

title.children: Train drivers 'coordinated' sick day to disrupt services, tribunal told

image.altText: A group of people running in a marathon.

props.synopsis: Athletes competing and training in hot, humid climates are faced with a different set of challenges, and with a warming climate, experts say learning to adapt is key.

title.children: Training in heat, humidity and pollution brings big challenges

image.altText: A woman looking on with a neutral expression on her face.

title.children: Four Corners Ukraine report sparks angry Russian government response

image.altText: a building with an orange sky

props.synopsis: Fire crews continues to battle the three major fires on Tasmania's west coast, but cooler temperatures and rainfall today have allowed the downgrading of a number of warnings, including Corinna and surrounds.

title.children: Tasmanians urged to remain alert about the fires as 'weather changes very erratically'

image.altText: A man standing with his arms folded, looking at another man who is sitting and speaking

title.children: Donald Trump's information overload tells us a lot about his strategy

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese, both wearing thick-rimmed glasses and looking stern.

props.synopsis: For once, in this parliament, it seemed the government was not just sitting like a hapless duck in the crosshairs of a question time attack.

title.children: Labor takes out its trash ahead of election and Albanese couldn't be happier

Young kids can benefit greatly from exposure to art, but some students, face many barriers to even get to an art gallery.

props.synopsis: A critical incident investigation is underway after a man, believed to be in his 40s, was tasered and shot by police at Mayfield, in the NSW Hunter region.

title.children: 'It escalated quickly': 54yo man warns others of heart attack signs

image.altText: Back of Helga Lam next to court justice scales

title.children: Four men who allege they were abused by female teacher agree to $2.5m settlement

image.altText: Jay-z 2025

title.children: 'Bad data' possibly used by Black Hawk crew before Washington DC crash

image.altText: A female gorilla at Melbourne Zoo

props.synopsis: Vets at Melbourne Zoo are investigating the death of a 20-year-old gorilla named Kimya, who died on Saturday morning.

title.children: Melbourne Zoo investigating sudden death of gorilla

image.altText: a red car is stuck in a mudslide while a man and a dog walk past

props.synopsis: A climate scientist has said that while the area of Southern California is desperate for rain, this storm might bring too much too quickly.

title.children: Southern California hit by mudslides weeks after devastating fire
